actio_python_utils.spark_functions.split_dataframe_to_csv_by_column_value¶

actio_python_utils.spark_functions.split_dataframe_to_csv_by_column_value(self, column_to_split_on, output_directory, filename_format='{column_value}', include_header=True, overwrite=True, include_split_column_in_new_files=False)[source]¶

Split a dataframe with PySpark to a set of gzipped CSVs, e.g. if a dataframe has data: col1,col2,col3 1,1,1 1,2,3 2,1,1

and we split on col1, we will produce two files, the first file (col1=1) containing col2,col3 1,1 2,3

and the second (col1=2) containing col2,col3 1,1

Parameters:

  • self (DataFrame) – The dataframe to use

  • column_to_split_on (str) – The column name to split on

  • output_directory (str) – The directory to output to

  • filename_format (str, default: '{column_value}') – Filename convention to use; use {column_value} to refer to the split column’s value

  • include_header (bool, default: True) – Whether to include a header in each output file

  • overwrite (bool, default: True) – Overwrite existing directory it if already exists

  • include_split_column_in_new_files (bool, default: False) – Whether to include the column that was used to split in the resulting files

Return type:

None
